pr_title: Modified search to show if an asset is broken

timeline.bodyText:
One of our style rules is to avoid star imports. IntelliJ defaults to using them however.
You'll need to go into settings and change the number of imports required before a star is used up to 99. It's pain that we can't automatically do that at the moment but oh well
timeline.author: syntaxi

timeline.bodyText: We try and have all variables have useful names, even if they're not used much. Here I'd suggest something like matchingBlocks or even just outputList
timeline.author: syntaxi

replies.bodyText: Fixed! Will keep this in mind from now on .
replies.author: vedant-shroff

timeline.bodyText: See my above comment about naming. (Although this variable could easily be joined with the following line
timeline.author: syntaxi

timeline.bodyText:
Would it be possible to instead of returning here, to just keep looping through the for block?
That way the broken assets will be skipped but the rest of the command will still work and the printing will still work.
timeline.author: syntaxi

replies.bodyText: Good idea, Sorry for not implementing this initially , it was on my mind but I forgot about it once I was done with the functionality . This is the new output after this change.
replies.author: vedant-shroff

timeline.bodyText: The cleanup of the method is appreciated, but this line seems like it has just been removed. Is it actually not needed, because it looks like it's used in spawning the prefab.
timeline.author: syntaxi

replies.bodyText: Fixed , Turns out I was using a slightly older branch which had an outdated version of this method , have replaced it with the correct implementation along with other changes
replies.author: vedant-shroff
